question.text: A coin is placed on a horizontal platform which undergoes vertical simple harmonic motion of angular frequency <math><mrow><mi>ω</mi></mrow></math>. The amplitude of oscillation is gradually increased. The coin will leave contact with the platform for the first time

options.text: at the highest position of the platform
at the mean position of the platform

solution.text: In vertical simple harmonic motion, maximum acceleration <math> <mrow> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <mtext mathvariant="italic">a</mtext> <msup> <mi>ω</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfenced> </mrow> </math> and so the maximum force <math> <mrow> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <mtext mathvariant="italic">m</mtext> <mtext mathvariant="italic">a</mtext> <msup> <mi>ω</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfenced> </mrow> </math> will be at extreme positions. At highest position, force will be towards mean position and so it will be downwards. At lowest position, force will be towards mean position and so it will be upwards. This is opposite to weight direction of the coin. The coin will leave contact with the platform for the first time when <math> <mrow> <mtext mathvariant="italic">m</mtext> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <mtext mathvariant="italic">a</mtext> <msup> <mi>ω</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>≥</mo> <mtext mathvariant="italic">m</mtext> <mtext>g</mtext> </mrow> </math> at the lowest position of the platform.
